revised_title: Adjustments in Bacterial Reaction Systems: The Reducing Power of Bact. lactis aerogenes under Various Conditions
tldr: The author investigates the reducing power of Bact. lactis aerogenes under various conditions, including anaerobic and aerobic environments, and different nitrogen sources. They found that bacterial cells can adjust their reducing power through rapid changes in active intermediates and slower enzymatic modifications. The study has implications for understanding the coordination of bacterial cell mechanisms and their ability to adapt to different environments.
